New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers set a new franchise record with their 10th straight win by double digits
Key Match Events: Darius Garland shadowed LaMelo Ball for 94 feet and made an early statement by denying an inbound pass
Garland and Ball engaged in a spirited duel that set the tone for the game
Ball earned six of his 15 first-half points at the free-throw line, finishing with 24 points
Garland countered with four of his 13 points from the stripe, maintaining his poise as the Cavs built a commanding 15-point halftime lead
Pre-Game Insights: Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson emphasized the importance of a championship mindset and approaching each game as the most important game
Max Strus stated that the matchup could have been interpreted as a trap game, but the Cavs didn't care
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Atkinson praised the team's maturity and focus after coming back from a nine-day road trip
Atkinson said that the team's ability to handle their business with precision was a testament to their maturity and focus
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs' offense flowed seamlessly, with crisp ball movement and unselfishness resulting in assists on 29 of their 44 made baskets
Charlotte leaned heavily on isolation plays from Ball and Brandon Miller, managing just 19 assists as a team
The Cavs' Evan Mobley contributed 17 points, rounding out a cohesive offensive effort
Allen's dominance extended to the boards, where he secured his 20th double-double of the season with 11 rebounds
Others: The Cavaliers will face a true test on Wednesday as the Western Conference-leading Oklahoma City Thunder visit Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse
Darius Garland stated firmly that he wants to be an All-Star and plans on being in San Francisco
